commit_message:
Ensure MAC addresses characters are in the same case

Currently neutron can report ports to have MAC addresses
in upper case when they're created like that. In the meanwhile
libvirt configuration file always stores MAC in lower case
which leads to KeyError while trying to retrieve migrate_vif.

Closes-Bug: #1945646
Change-Id: Ie3129ee395427337e9abcef2f938012608f643e1

subject: Fix secret metadata access rules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-25 19:32:44.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/secretmeta.py', 'barbican/api/controllers/secrets.py', 'barbican/api/controllers/__init__.py', 'barbican/common/policies/base.py', 'barbican/common/policies/secretmeta.py'], 'message': 'Fix secret metadata access rules

This patch fixes the legacy policy rules for accessing secret metadata
by checking that the user making the request is authenticated for the
project that owns the secret.

project that owns the secret.

subject: Drop become in stackhpc.libvirt-vm for seed vm provision
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-10-27 09:00:15.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/story-2009277-84c381a562244fab.yaml', 'ansible/roles/infra-vms/tasks/deploy.yml', 'ansible/seed-vm-provision.yml'], 'message': 'Drop become in stackhpc.libvirt-vm for seed vm provision

Prior to this change, the seed VM was provisioned using the
stackhpc.livirt-vm role with become=true. This resulted in the cached
image being owned by root. The infra VM provisioning uses
stackhpc.libvirt-vm without become=true. If an infra VM uses the same
image as the seed, this can lead to permission denied errors when
downloading a new image of the same name.

This change adds a workaround to fix up the ownership of the cached
image during infra VM provisioning to avoid this issue.

This change also drops become=true from stackhpc.libvirt-vm during seed
VM provisioning, and adds the same workaround there.

Story: 2009277
Task: 43534

Change-Id: Iade0d74cdb398365a567dbdc4b23de2416f3726d
'}]
commit_message:
Drop become in stackhpc.libvirt-vm for seed vm provision

Prior to this change, the seed VM was provisioned using the
stackhpc.livirt-vm role with become=true. This resulted in the cached
image being owned by root. The infra VM provisioning uses
stackhpc.libvirt-vm without become=true. If an infra VM uses the same
image as the seed, this can lead to permission denied errors when
downloading a new image of the same name.

This change adds a workaround to fix up the ownership of the cached
image during infra VM provisioning to avoid this issue.

This change also drops become=true from stackhpc.libvirt-vm during seed
VM provisioning, and adds the same workaround there.

Story: 2009277
Task: 43534

Change-Id: Iade0d74cdb398365a567dbdc4b23de2416f3726d

commit_message:
Swift backend: the key parameter should be secret

The key parameter of swift backend is used to define a credentail to
access Swift so should be hidden in logs.

In Glance the user parameter(swift_store_user) is also defined as
a secret parameter. However it defines user name or id and user name
or id is not currently treated as secret in puppet, so this change
doesn't cover the user parameter.

Change-Id: Iac580df4de14ffdb19436417b2830a834efd087d
(cherry picked from commit 4a481929887d88f019467d11fb7c19d8d9311e3e)
(cherry picked from commit 048e9b458ba0283865fd8dd0dab05a4919a8c371)

commit_message:
CI: Disable heat in upgrade jobs to save disk space

We see frequent failures of upgrade jobs on stable branches due to lack
of disk space. Disable heat in an attempt to free up extra space, since
we do not need it for our testing.

Change-Id: I20c99ca9dd6e78b041e4662c9b1b54eac904e3c9

subject: fix container run defect
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2021-10-27 07:44:56.000000000', 'files': ['zun/api/controllers/v1/views/containers_view.py', 'zun/container/docker/driver.py'], 'message': 'fix container run defect

Some problems were found in the development of enterprise projects:

1.After repairing the container operation, the return parameter does not include the time parameter. It is necessary to judge whether to restart and obtain the running time in the business development. Compared with nova, the return info of the VM also contains the above information.

2.When creating a container, if a custom security group created with neutron is also associated, the expose_ports parameter is also given, which will cause the custom security group parameters to be overwritten, which is very important for the container to increase the exposure range of ports. Important, but it is currently a failure.

Change-Id: I1f5c2ddc835d91c14ae8936c0fb7f79d418ba804
'}]
commit_message:
fix container run defect

Some problems were found in the development of enterprise projects:

1.After repairing the container operation, the return parameter does not include the time parameter. It is necessary to judge whether to restart and obtain the running time in the business development. Compared with nova, the return info of the VM also contains the above information.

2.When creating a container, if a custom security group created with neutron is also associated, the expose_ports parameter is also given, which will cause the custom security group parameters to be overwritten, which is very important for the container to increase the exposure range of ports. Important, but it is currently a failure.

Change-Id: I1f5c2ddc835d91c14ae8936c0fb7f79d418ba804

commit_message:
Set proxy option in early dnf invocation

If hosts need to use a proxy to install packages and python is absent,
the call to install the python package will hang, at least on CentOS.

Set proxy if it exists in dnf_config using a command-line option. Later
uses of dnf will be after dnf.conf has been updated.

Change-Id: Ic949577afd3ea07306cebf224637a08a1ecce0f5
Story: 2009274
Task: 43528
(cherry picked from commit 29d73eed7a175f8d4126570c3321dc966f0547f1)

commit_message:
Set update containers logic in release files

set updating containers in release files, we need to update them
in check jobs, but not in periodic or promotion jobs, or any job
we build containers.

Closes-Bug: #1902190
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/761285
Change-Id: I9a6855740f9742d577f456121305080b1cbfdd25

subject: Ignore installed packages when building base container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-08-25 13:20:34.000000000', 'files': ['container-images/tcib/base/base.yaml'], 'message': 'Ignore installed packages when building base container

If current container already contains one of packages that are
going to be installed with "rpm -ivh" it will fail with message
"package ... is already installed". Fix it by forcing install even
when it exists using "--replacepkgs" for rpm.

Change-Id: I9e90a8553fe53cdb4d4e430c68039de861578b80
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore installed packages when building base container

If current container already contains one of packages that are
going to be installed with "rpm -ivh" it will fail with message
"package ... is already installed". Fix it by forcing install even
when it exists using "--replacepkgs" for rpm.

Change-Id: I9e90a8553fe53cdb4d4e430c68039de861578b80

commit_message:
Add option to ignore ephemeral device for swap

Use option force_skip_ephemeral if you don't want to use existing
ephemeral device for swap, but rather create it on root partition.
Change-Id: Ifd86372846039f224912964ff9380a1d0093b6c2

revisions:

The anaconda deploy interface, when doing a deploy, doesn't use
the agent ramdisk. However, cleans and rescues with the anaconda
deploy interface use the agent ramdisk so we want ironic to manage
the agent boot process.

Change-Id: I67f961717b7f358083a3b59f678b80360f591c63
"}]
commit_message:
anaconda interface, clean/rescue use agent ramdisk

The anaconda deploy interface, when doing a deploy, doesn't use
the agent ramdisk. However, cleans and rescues with the anaconda
deploy interface use the agent ramdisk so we want ironic to manage
the agent boot process.

Change-Id: I67f961717b7f358083a3b59f678b80360f591c63

commit_message:
Add enable_secure_rbac option to fs020 and fs001

To support testing fs020, fs001 with and without
secure RBAC, this patch adds a var
to add the environments/enable-secure-rbac.yaml
template.

Tests are added in:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdo-jobs/+/36121

commit_message:
Add parameter IronicPowerStateChangeTimeout

A heat parameter ``IronicPowerStateChangeTimeout`` has been added
which sets the number of seconds to wait for power operations to
complete, i.e., so that a baremetal node is in the desired power
state. If timed out, the power operation is considered a failure. The
default is 60 seconds, which is the same as the current Ironic
default.

This could be backported to stable/train, where the ironic default of
30s is causing failures in CI jobs.

Related-Bug: #1947403
Change-Id: I9729beac4c4e84d2619c4c629cd26eba8a26b87d

commit_message:
Remove ganesha_vip extra config workaround

for scenario004

We were using extra config to set ganesha_vip because it was unset
if the isolated StorageNFS network is not deployed, as it is with
Standalone deployment in CI.

Now it is set, and set to an address on the external net where guest
VMs can reach it.

Related-Bug: #1911022
Change-Id: Ic20b3aaccc18c19973a07798f20a63ac9d5c0bb7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-21 12:49:23.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/fix_efi_uuid_fstab-f2edbee9bfbac64a.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/extensions/image.py'], 'message': 'Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab

commit_message:
Assert EFI part UUID is not None before editing fstab

The EFI partition UUID may be None and this will break
the fstab editing. While this is not necessarily fatal when
instantiating a node, it creates an exception at the end of
bootloader installation, so only attempt to add a line to
fstab when the UUID is not None.

Change-Id: I68799980e67c05afe4ca68ca9733605dd166d54d
(cherry picked from commit 333ed70c94e366f16d8f2633f74a5ef05aa5fadb)

commit_message:
Release horizon 20.2.0(Yoga)

This is the first release for Yoga. The minor version is bumped as we
have changes in requirements.txt(Django>=2.2,<3.0 changed to >=2.2,<3.3).
Horizon bumps the upper version of Django to Django3.2. So this patch
cut a new release of the horizon so that all plugins can consume
this change. For more information please see [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/815393

Change-Id: Ie0e7c22fff759016b10b3f4c143928323dfb90b4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-27 00:04:20.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/conductor-power-sync-timeout-extension-fa5e7b5fdd679d84.yaml', 'ironic/conf/conductor.py'], 'message': "Extend power sync timeout for Ericsson SDI

Ericsson SDI uses cached power state data in what is returned
to the API user, and typically this takes longer than 30 seconds
to provide an updated value to the API user.

As such, if we do not extend the timeout value, such users of
Ironic's Redfish API interface will have deployments fail as
the power state timeout will be encountered.

This change landed in ussuri, and is proposed to stable/train due to
TripleO CI failures.

Related-Bug: #1947403
Change-Id: I0aa5131504b60b13d43c73c9a3be1f50f7855cbc
(cherry picked from commit 4383303dfbfe15f3dfbd8be8d4cc6d70aa703019)
"}]
commit_message:
Extend power sync timeout for Ericsson SDI

Ericsson SDI uses cached power state data in what is returned
to the API user, and typically this takes longer than 30 seconds
to provide an updated value to the API user.

As such, if we do not extend the timeout value, such users of
Ironic's Redfish API interface will have deployments fail as
the power state timeout will be encountered.

This change landed in ussuri, and is proposed to stable/train due to
TripleO CI failures.

Related-Bug: #1947403
Change-Id: I0aa5131504b60b13d43c73c9a3be1f50f7855cbc

commit_message:
Add support for revised RFC8227 withdraw labels

This commit fixes a parsing error when a BGP update contains a "withdraw label"
equal to 0x000000 instead of 0x8000000 as stated in RFC 3107. This commits
treats both labels as "withdraw label"

Signed-off-by: Benjamin Villain <villainb@amazon.com>
Signed-off-by: FUJITA Tomonori <fujita.tomonori@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Backported from
https://github.com/faucetsdn/ryu/commit/62b4c07464c67227fd35026291c90aa006072841

Story: #2009283
Task: #43557
Change-Id: I53f1e09af54c12b1724ab8e93373885c0ab11bab

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-20 04:50:27.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ipmi_command_retry_timeout-889a49b402e82b97.yaml', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipmitool.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_ipmitool.py'], 'message': 'Fix ipmitool timing argument calculation

Calculating the ipmitool `-N` and `-R` arguments from ironic.conf
[ipmi] `command_retry_timeout` and `min_command_interval` now takes
into account the 1 second interval increment that ipmitool adds on
each retry event.

Failure-path ipmitool run duration will now be just less than
`command_retry_timeout` instead of much longer.

Change-Id: Ia3d8d85497651290c62341ac121e2aa438b4ac50
(cherry picked from commit 1de3db3b16f3e0475e506e540ca5d5ed6edb4cbf)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ipmitool timing argument calculation

Calculating the ipmitool `-N` and `-R` arguments from ironic.conf
[ipmi] `command_retry_timeout` and `min_command_interval` now takes
into account the 1 second interval increment that ipmitool adds on
each retry event.

Failure-path ipmitool run duration will now be just less than
`command_retry_timeout` instead of much longer.

Change-Id: Ia3d8d85497651290c62341ac121e2aa438b4ac50
(cherry picked from commit 1de3db3b16f3e0475e506e540ca5d5ed6edb4cbf)

commit_message:
Improve "get_collection_count" calls

Reduce the object retrieval to one single field to improve the
collection count.

Bumped neutron-lib to 2.16.0. This version contains [1], needed for
this patch.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/807686

Related-Bug: #1942863

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-05-04 02:16:25.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I118a1237071f206e434997377fb46c02fe11eb08
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I118a1237071f206e434997377fb46c02fe11eb08

commit_message:
Remove unicode from code

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I502bda0881b284d918f4afedba9bb24eb560211f

commit_message:
Fix an issue with Adjutant's Invite process not checking inherited roles

Adjutant's InviteUser action was not correctly checking inherited roles
which might allow someone to invite/create another user with roles outside
of those they inviting user can manage.

Change-Id: I1f45da4ce5ee6d1295a17767c432875c23106b15
Story: #2009326
(cherry picked from commit ab7f8115d45de5eb4ea76eda0996a559f6b4b508)

commit_message:
Fix an issue with Adjutant's Invite process not checking inherited roles

Adjutant's InviteUser action was not correctly checking inherited roles
which might allow someone to invite/create another user with roles outside
of those they inviting user can manage.

Change-Id: I1f45da4ce5ee6d1295a17767c432875c23106b15
Story: #2009326
(cherry picked from commit ab7f8115d45de5eb4ea76eda0996a559f6b4b508)

commit_message:
Make sure resource_op_defaults are set before bundles

See LP#1948032. We set a higher default resource op time out because
podman often times out within the default 20s. We need to guarantee
that this timeout is set *before* we create any bundles otherwise
it might be too late and we'd fail a deployment like described in the
LP.

Change-Id: Ic6ac8d21d12389e70cd382018290324d3ae948ce
Closes-Bug: #1948032
(cherry picked from commit e4e9be76dc3f6f1a1ee3f79e05d5167eddc34563)
(cherry picked from commit fbdc1403bf5dd7e91b4c93a631346cd8cde5b43f)

commit_message:
Make sure resource_op_defaults are set before bundles

See LP#1948032. We set a higher default resource op time out because
podman often times out within the default 20s. We need to guarantee
that this timeout is set *before* we create any bundles otherwise
it might be too late and we'd fail a deployment like described in the
LP.

Change-Id: Ic6ac8d21d12389e70cd382018290324d3ae948ce
Closes-Bug: #1948032
(cherry picked from commit e4e9be76dc3f6f1a1ee3f79e05d5167eddc34563)
(cherry picked from commit fbdc1403bf5dd7e91b4c93a631346cd8cde5b43f)

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: I849af3b400839d52cf1d78931f40532cb2973c96

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-12-17 13:31:10.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/policy.py'], 'message': 'Fix failure of functional-py35

In oslo.policy 1.43.1, class Enforcer - function enforce will try to
deepcopy the parameter "target", but "target" is not always
deepcopyable. e.g. When target is like:

-------------------------------------------------------------------
target={'visibility': 'public', 'status': 'saving', 'min_disk': 0,
'image_id': '51d6417b-7ca0-4aad-aa10-fc2836fdb857', 'created_at':
datetime.datetime(2018, 12, 17, 7, 6, 50, 588985), 'os_hidden': False,
'name': 'Image1', 'owner': None, 'extra_properties': {}, 'size':
None, 'locations': <glance.quota.QuotaImageLocationsProxy object at
0x7f4fef0c1780>, 'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 12, 17, 7, 6, 50,
588985), 'tags': <glance.quota.QuotaImageTagsProxy object at
0x7f4fef0c1710>, 'os_hash_algo': None, 'virtual_size': None,
'container_format': 'bare', 'os_hash_value': None, 'checksum':
None, 'protected': False, 'disk_format': 'raw', 'min_ram': 0}
-------------------------------------------------------------------

So try to copy simple data types from target and save in a new dict,
then pass this simpled dict to policy module.

This patch also fixed a KeyError exception.

Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix failure of functional-py35

In oslo.policy 1.43.1, class Enforcer - function enforce will try to
deepcopy the parameter "target", but "target" is not always
deepcopyable. e.g. When target is like:

-------------------------------------------------------------------
target={'visibility': 'public', 'status': 'saving', 'min_disk': 0,
'image_id': '51d6417b-7ca0-4aad-aa10-fc2836fdb857', 'created_at':
datetime.datetime(2018, 12, 17, 7, 6, 50, 588985), 'os_hidden': False,
'name': 'Image1', 'owner': None, 'extra_properties': {}, 'size':
None, 'locations': <glance.quota.QuotaImageLocationsProxy object at
0x7f4fef0c1780>, 'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2018, 12, 17, 7, 6, 50,
588985), 'tags': <glance.quota.QuotaImageTagsProxy object at
0x7f4fef0c1710>, 'os_hash_algo': None, 'virtual_size': None,
'container_format': 'bare', 'os_hash_value': None, 'checksum':
None, 'protected': False, 'disk_format': 'raw', 'min_ram': 0}
-------------------------------------------------------------------

So try to copy simple data types from target and save in a new dict,
then pass this simpled dict to policy module.

This patch also fixed a KeyError exception.

Change-Id: Ia8a52738d347e267161eb82cc76b00ba826213f7
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for tenant-ceph

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I649512e17fc62049fef5b9d5e05c69c0e99635f9

commit_message:
Remove helm status from deployment scripts for podsecuritypolicy

With the move to helm v3, helm status requires a namespace to be specified, but doing so breaks helm v2 compatability. This change removes the usage of helm serve in openstack-helm-infra's deployment scripts.

Change-Id: I7ed4a88fca679b1d27c74f0e260e690093fdf591

subject: [WIP] Fix LCM failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-25 00:25:36.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/unit/vnflcm/test_load_vnf_interfaces.py', 'tacker/conductor/conductorrpc/vnf_lcm_rpc.py', 'tacker/api/vnflcm/v1/controller.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/vnflcm/test_vnflcm_driver.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor_server.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/vnflcm/fakes.py', 'tacker/conf/vnf_lcm.py', 'tacker/plugins/common/constants.py', 'tacker/conductor/conductor_server.py', 'tacker/vnflcm/vnflcm_driver.py', 'tacker/db/vnfm/vnfm_db.py', 'tacker/tests/utils.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Fix LCM failure

In current implementation, if the tacker servers go down during LCM
operation, the operation state will be fixed to `PROCESSING` even after
servers restart. Once this problem happens, users cannot chagne the
operation state with APIs, which means users have to change the state by
updating DB directly.

This patch fix this problem by changing the state of LCM operations in
`PROCESSING` to `FAILED_TEMP` when the servers restart. As restarting
can be triggered for other reasons than server down issues, only the
state that is in `PROCESSING` beyond the predefined timeout are changed.
Note that, in order to realize the above, the server saves `error_point`
every time it is updated instead of saving it in memory.

In addition, this patch includes the following minor fixes and
refactoring:

- Reformatted args in UT
- Removed redundant `_scale_vnf` method as this method does nothing
- Removed `vnf_instance` and `vnf_lcm_op_occ` from the arguments of
`_update_vnf_scaling` method as these are updated without using this
method in many places
- Moved the definition of status constants from `conductor_server.py` to
`constants.py`
- Explicitly imported the Vim model for the VNF model as Vim model must
be imported before `tacker/db/vnfm/vnfm_db.py` [1], otherwise
`InvalidRequestError` will occur

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/basic_relationships.html#late-evaluation-of-relationship-arguments

Change-Id: Id3d60db9498884b0d64f2d96028201c1f3cf2fff
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Fix LCM failure

In current implementation, if the tacker servers go down during LCM
operation, the operation state will be fixed to `PROCESSING` even after
servers restart. Once this problem happens, users cannot chagne the
operation state with APIs, which means users have to change the state by
updating DB directly.

This patch fix this problem by changing the state of LCM operations in
`PROCESSING` to `FAILED_TEMP` when the servers restart. As restarting
can be triggered for other reasons than server down issues, only the
state that is in `PROCESSING` beyond the predefined timeout are changed.
Note that, in order to realize the above, the server saves `error_point`
every time it is updated instead of saving it in memory.

In addition, this patch includes the following minor fixes and
refactoring:

- Reformatted args in UT
- Removed redundant `_scale_vnf` method as this method does nothing
- Removed `vnf_instance` and `vnf_lcm_op_occ` from the arguments of
`_update_vnf_scaling` method as these are updated without using this
method in many places
- Moved the definition of status constants from `conductor_server.py` to
`constants.py`
- Explicitly imported the Vim model for the VNF model as Vim model must
be imported before `tacker/db/vnfm/vnfm_db.py` [1], otherwise
`InvalidRequestError` will occur

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/basic_relationships.html#late-evaluation-of-relationship-arguments

Change-Id: Id3d60db9498884b0d64f2d96028201c1f3cf2fff

subject: Preinstall requirements for docs build and fix lower constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-10-26 18:23:40.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Preinstall requirements for docs build and fix lower constraints

Sphinx installs the package with its dependencies, but it does not use
the constraints. This can lead to errors if a dependency introduces any
backward incompatible changes. To avoid this the dependencies needs to
be installed prior to sphinx run by tox with the correct constraints.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

NOTE(elod.illes):
* conflict is due to branch specific upper constraints setting patch.
* this patch also corrects the contradicting lower constraints to make
  the lower-constraints job pass (with the new pip dependency resolver,
  introduced in pip 20.3, the job started to show the contradictions
  and thus started to fail):
  - pycodestyle 2.0.0 is required by flake8 2.6.2
  - MarkupSafe 1.1 is required by some not so old setuptools (this is
    not required in zuul gate, but fails locally usually)
  - warlock 1.3.0 is disallowed by python-glanceclient
* requirements-check job fails with error at bindep install:
    No package matching 'python-guestfs' is available
  and the job runs on ubuntu-focal node. This patch changes the nodeset
  to ubuntu-bionic where 'python-guestfs' still exists.

Change-Id: I4ba83f1007dd11801b8e32c6d7566769e005480b
(cherry picked from commit e0136189fc147deb7c4b92ed93eabb3cdcb9b7bb)
(cherry picked from commit 0900fc028cd46e368e5fad2cf6f5e73a240b295f)
(cherry picked from commit 44ac39ad4d58c41dfa591e4873fcfc84102850d6)
(cherry picked from commit 699744e863498d16392150925b4d8ae60526f035)
"}]
commit_message:
Preinstall requirements for docs build and fix lower constraints

Sphinx installs the package with its dependencies, but it does not use
the constraints. This can lead to errors if a dependency introduces any
backward incompatible changes. To avoid this the dependencies needs to
be installed prior to sphinx run by tox with the correct constraints.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

NOTE(elod.illes):
* conflict is due to branch specific upper constraints setting patch.
* this patch also corrects the contradicting lower constraints to make
  the lower-constraints job pass (with the new pip dependency resolver,
  introduced in pip 20.3, the job started to show the contradictions
  and thus started to fail):
  - pycodestyle 2.0.0 is required by flake8 2.6.2
  - MarkupSafe 1.1 is required by some not so old setuptools (this is
    not required in zuul gate, but fails locally usually)
  - warlock 1.3.0 is disallowed by python-glanceclient
* requirements-check job fails with error at bindep install:
    No package matching 'python-guestfs' is available
  and the job runs on ubuntu-focal node. This patch changes the nodeset
  to ubuntu-bionic where 'python-guestfs' still exists.

Change-Id: I4ba83f1007dd11801b8e32c6d7566769e005480b
(cherry picked from commit e0136189fc147deb7c4b92ed93eabb3cdcb9b7bb)
(cherry picked from commit 0900fc028cd46e368e5fad2cf6f5e73a240b295f)
(cherry picked from commit 44ac39ad4d58c41dfa591e4873fcfc84102850d6)
(cherry picked from commit 699744e863498d16392150925b4d8ae60526f035)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-10-26 09:40:35.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/worker/v1/tasks/network_tasks.py'], 'message': 'Fix failover of az-specific loadbalancers

There is a bug exists in CalculateAmphoraDelta class
If there is no such a key as constants.MANAGEMENT_NETWORK
in availability_zone dictionary, method get will return None
It means that management_nets list will become [None], not
CONF.controller_worker.amp_boot_network_list as it supposes to be
It breaks the following failover flow

Story: 2008669
Task: 41957
Change-Id: I435c40a5493828bce24c2850182f0ddc8e5bdd1f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix failover of az-specific loadbalancers

There is a bug exists in CalculateAmphoraDelta class
If there is no such a key as constants.MANAGEMENT_NETWORK
in availability_zone dictionary, method get will return None
It means that management_nets list will become [None], not
CONF.controller_worker.amp_boot_network_list as it supposes to be
It breaks the following failover flow

Story: 2008669
Task: 41957
Change-Id: I435c40a5493828bce24c2850182f0ddc8e5bdd1f

commit_message:
Fix management network selection when calculating deltas

Providing an AZ dict without the 'management_network' field to
CalculateAmphoraDelta task broke the calculation of the interfaces to be
deleted. As a result, the management interface might have been removed
by the HandleNetworkDelta task.

Change-Id: I72796b3ed1c3f180cca8c005fdbad81d9dbef37d

commit_message:
Fix management network selection when calculating deltas

Providing an AZ dict without the 'management_network' field to
CalculateAmphoraDelta task broke the calculation of the interfaces to be
deleted. As a result, the management interface might have been removed
by the HandleNetworkDelta task.

Change-Id: I72796b3ed1c3f180cca8c005fdbad81d9dbef37d
(cherry picked from commit b41b275b8314f79cdafe1575d84aface2b5861c5)

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2021-10-26 08:56:05.000000000', 'files': ['install-deps.sh'], 'message': 'Use venv instead of virtualenv on EL9.

In Centos9, virtualenv package is not available. With python3,
We don't need virtualenv and we can use "python3 -m venv"
to create virtual environments.

With this patch, Updating install-deps.sh to not install
python3-virtualenv and make use of "python3 -m venv" on
Entreprise Linux 9.

We can use use python3 -m venv" even on Centos8 as well, and even
on Centos7 as python3 is present on 7.8+. But, with this patch

virtualenv if we decide to get rid of virtualenv usage for older

as this part of code does nothing even if packages are missing, and
Virtualenv/setuptools installation is already covered in prior steps.

Change-Id: I1b8bb40a4b815db6f3da1d91c816077ccb8f2ac2
'}]
commit_message:
Use venv instead of virtualenv on EL9.

In Centos9, virtualenv package is not available. With python3,
We don't need virtualenv and we can use "python3 -m venv"
to create virtual environments.

With this patch, Updating install-deps.sh to not install
python3-virtualenv and make use of "python3 -m venv" on
Entreprise Linux 9.

We can use use python3 -m venv" even on Centos8 as well, and even
on Centos7 as python3 is present on 7.8+. But, with this patch
we are 'only modifying what we had to' for c9 for now.

We can do a separate effort for older OS releases for cleanup of
virtualenv if we decide to get rid of virtualenv usage for older
OS releases and older distros.

Also, removing check_python_module check for virtualenv & setuptools
as this part of code does nothing even if packages are missing, and
Virtualenv/setuptools installation is already covered in prior steps.

Change-Id: I1b8bb40a4b815db6f3da1d91c816077ccb8f2ac2

commit_message:
Increasing max servers

The cloud is very stable at 36, the maximum due to IPv4 limitations is
51 for now, so we're going with 51. I am actively monitoring the cloud workloads,
performance, workload spread, etc for any issues.

Change-Id: Ia5e0f04668739537da9d9ef58600be229df0e9b3

commit_message:
Add option to configure snmpd auth type

MD5 will not work under FIPS.  We need a way to configure the
snmpd auth type to something other than MD5 (the other supported
option is SHA).  Otherwise snmpd will not start up under FIPS.

Change-Id: I92e6c5283f6d0ba605fa2c0bcda6bea9041a0f4f

subject: Use custom JSONType columns
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-07-13 09:44:06.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/persistence/backends/sqlalchemy/tables.py'], 'message': "Use custom JSONType columns

the JSONType from sqlalchemy_utils is quite brittle as it only does
primitive json.dumps on values. This leads to various sorts of
StorageFailure exceptions in taskflow when, for example, an unserializable
exception bubbles up to the 'failure' field of AtomDetails.

This patch sublclasses the JSONType from sqlalchemy_utils and overrides
two of its methods that do (de)serialization to work via
oslo.serialization functions. They deal with such occurencies much
better, for example, by providing 'str' as a fallback default.

Change-Id: I3b9e9498b155199a4e707006a0cf22cda0567c06
Related-Bug: #1935957
"}]
commit_message:
Use custom JSONType columns

the JSONType from sqlalchemy_utils is quite brittle as it only does
primitive json.dumps on values. This leads to various sorts of
StorageFailure exceptions in taskflow when, for example, an unserializable
exception bubbles up to the 'failure' field of AtomDetails.

This patch sublclasses the JSONType from sqlalchemy_utils and overrides
two of its methods that do (de)serialization to work via
oslo.serialization functions. They deal with such occurencies much
better, for example, by providing 'str' as a fallback default.

Change-Id: I3b9e9498b155199a4e707006a0cf22cda0567c06
Related-Bug: #1935957

revisions:

longer to register on all hosts, and vm/server is instantiated almost

This PS enhances the cell-setup-init script to enable option to

Change-Id: Ie9867e64c554d4f39fdc7432823a1869f0b4a520

commit_message:
Add option to extend the wait for cell-setup-init

  In some deployement environments, nova compute processes took a bit
longer to register on all hosts, and vm/server is instantiated almost
immediately before the process is registered on remaining hosts.
This PS enhances the cell-setup-init script to enable option to
extend the wait before performing discover hosts.

Change-Id: Ie9867e64c554d4f39fdc7432823a1869f0b4a520

subject: Preinstall requirements for docs build and fix lower constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2021-10-26 15:03:11.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Preinstall requirements for docs build and fix lower constraints

Sphinx installs the package with its dependencies, but it does not use
the constraints. This can lead to errors if a dependency introduces any
backward incompatible changes. To avoid this the dependencies needs to
be installed prior to sphinx run by tox with the correct constraints.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

NOTE(elod.illes):
* conflict is due to branch specific upper constraints setting patch.
* this patch also corrects the contradicting lower constraints to make
  the lower-constraints job pass (with the new pip dependency resolver,
  introduced in pip 20.3, the job started to show the contradictions
  and thus started to fail):
  - hacking >= 3.0 is required according to test-requirements.txt
  - mccabe 0.6.0 and pyflakes 2.0.0 is required by flake 3.6.0, which
    is required by hacking 3.0.0
  - MarkupSafe 1.1 is required by some not so old setuptools (this is
    not required in zuul gate, but fails locally usually)
  - warlock 1.3.0 is disallowed by python-glanceclient
* requirements-check job fails with error at bindep install:
    No package matching 'python-guestfs' is available
  and the job runs on ubuntu-focal node. This patch changes the nodeset
  to ubuntu-bionic where 'python-guestfs' still exists.

Change-Id: I4ba83f1007dd11801b8e32c6d7566769e005480b
(cherry picked from commit e0136189fc147deb7c4b92ed93eabb3cdcb9b7bb)
(cherry picked from commit 0900fc028cd46e368e5fad2cf6f5e73a240b295f)
(cherry picked from commit 44ac39ad4d58c41dfa591e4873fcfc84102850d6)
"}]
commit_message:
Preinstall requirements for docs build and fix lower constraints

Sphinx installs the package with its dependencies, but it does not use
the constraints. This can lead to errors if a dependency introduces any
backward incompatible changes. To avoid this the dependencies needs to
be installed prior to sphinx run by tox with the correct constraints.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

NOTE(elod.illes):
* conflict is due to branch specific upper constraints setting patch.
* this patch also corrects the contradicting lower constraints to make
  the lower-constraints job pass (with the new pip dependency resolver,
  introduced in pip 20.3, the job started to show the contradictions
  and thus started to fail):
  - hacking >= 3.0 is required according to test-requirements.txt
  - mccabe 0.6.0 and pyflakes 2.0.0 is required by flake 3.6.0, which
    is required by hacking 3.0.0
  - MarkupSafe 1.1 is required by some not so old setuptools (this is
    not required in zuul gate, but fails locally usually)
  - warlock 1.3.0 is disallowed by python-glanceclient
* requirements-check job fails with error at bindep install:
    No package matching 'python-guestfs' is available
  and the job runs on ubuntu-focal node. This patch changes the nodeset
  to ubuntu-bionic where 'python-guestfs' still exists.

Change-Id: I4ba83f1007dd11801b8e32c6d7566769e005480b
(cherry picked from commit e0136189fc147deb7c4b92ed93eabb3cdcb9b7bb)
(cherry picked from commit 0900fc028cd46e368e5fad2cf6f5e73a240b295f)
(cherry picked from commit 44ac39ad4d58c41dfa591e4873fcfc84102850d6)

subject: [WIP] Add tripleo inventory CLI entry point.
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2021-04-21 13:13:30.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/tripleo_inventory.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': '[WIP] Add tripleo inventory CLI entry point.

In order to get rid of the tripleo-ansible-inventory script located in
tripleo-validations, this patch will add a CLI entry point for generating
the TripleO Ansible inventory via all the deployment types available:
* non heat stack available
* undercloud only
* undercloud/overcloud
* ephemeral heat

Change-Id: Ic6e24db1da82eb234bb8338c39649719d47b2807

commit_message:
[WIP] Add tripleo inventory CLI entry point.

In order to get rid of the tripleo-ansible-inventory script located in
tripleo-validations, this patch will add a CLI entry point for generating
the TripleO Ansible inventory via all the deployment types available:
* non heat stack available
* undercloud only
* undercloud/overcloud
* ephemeral heat

This review will expose utils function to serve other CLI entries which used
the tripleo-ansible-inventory script.

Change-Id: Ic6e24db1da82eb234bb8338c39649719d47b2807

right location.

subject: Update default forwarder for ipa-multinode role
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-10-21 19:04:57.000000000', 'files': ['roles/ipa-multinode/defaults/main.yml', 'roles/ipa-multinode/tasks/ipaserver-subnode-install.yml'], 'message': 'Update default forwarder for ipa-multinode role

This patch updates the default forwarder address for ipa-multinode
install role, since some addresses are failing in initial validations
made by ipa-server-install process.
The patch adds a forwarder skip list that avoids the use of some
addresses even when they are found in the unbound forwarder
configuration.

Related-Bug: #1947144
Change-Id: I91032d411bbc35092cc6e00abd8238fd11c032eb
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update default forwarder for ipa-multinode role

This patch updates the default forwarder address for ipa-multinode
install role, since some addresses are failing in initial validations
made by ipa-server-install process.
The patch adds a forwarder skip list that avoids the use of some
addresses even when they are found in the unbound forwarder
configuration.

Related-Bug: #1947144
Change-Id: I91032d411bbc35092cc6e00abd8238fd11c032eb
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Metadata for User facing resources

This change adds resource metadata tables and
APIs for the following resources:

- Shares
- Share Export Locations
- Share Instances
- Share Instance Export Locations
- Share Replicas
- Share Replica Export Locations
- Snapshots
- Share Groups
- Share Group Snapshots
- Security Services
- Share Networks
- Share Network Subnets

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-implements: bp/metadata-for-share-resources
Change-Id: I2e7d6edafc929e1c63425f6f4be02335fc263a34

Change-Id: I9b23a47801abc8914cb406292780e423591e0573

commit_message:
Update local_id limit to 255 characters

This avoids the "String length exceeded." error, when using LDAP
domain specific backend in case the user uses a user id
attribute, which can exceed the previous constraint of 64 chars.

Change-Id: I923a2a2a5e79c8f265ff436e96258288dddb867b
Closes-Bug: #1929066
Resolves: rhbz#1959345
(cherry picked from commit ce6031ca12156620cec214a49d162ec7bb30752f)

commit_message:
Replace "tenant_id" with "project_id"

Replace "tenant_id" with "project_id" in:
- Trunk service
- QoS plugin service

This is part of the remaining technical debt of the specs
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/newton/moving-to-keystone-v3.html

Change-Id: I39d049bb506f24d1e1e2a35b659c93d0a22093f8
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/keystone-v3

commit_message:
Update certifi version

In order for services to use relevant CA files we need to use latest
certifi package. Previous version does not include updated Let's Encrypt
CA file

subject: Check subnet in "_remove_subnet_dhcp_options"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-10-25 11:17:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovn_client.py'], 'message': 'Check subnet in "_remove_subnet_dhcp_options"

Since [1], "get_subnet_dhcp_options" returns always a dictionary
in "subnet" instead of None. This patch checks not only that "subnet"
is None but also the dictionary is not empty.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/807692

Closes-Bug: #1948466

Change-Id: Ie93cf3e47e09b3e5051be1ffad512251775b0492
'}]
commit_message:
Check subnet in "_remove_subnet_dhcp_options"

Since [1], "get_subnet_dhcp_options" returns always a dictionary
in "subnet" instead of None. This patch checks not only that "subnet"
is None but also the dictionary is not empty.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/807692

Closes-Bug: #1948466

Change-Id: Ie93cf3e47e09b3e5051be1ffad512251775b0492

subject: Reinstating InMotion cloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-26 17:56:09.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nl02.opendev.org.yaml'], 'message': 'Reinstating InMotion cloud

IPs have been added, compute nodes have been added, nova-scheduler
configured for spread, placement configured for randomization of hosts
system capacity in place, placement optimized for maximum allocation of VMs.
Starting with 36, goal target is 51, depends on how CPU bottlenecks looks like with spread.

Change-Id: I6d3d00081a983be0fdf0adbe66b79751439fcce5
'}]
commit_message:
Reinstating InMotion cloud

IPs have been added, compute nodes have been added, nova-scheduler
configured for spread, placement configured for randomization of hosts
system capacity in place, placement optimized for maximum allocation of VMs.
Starting with 36, goal target is 51, depends on how CPU bottlenecks looks like with spread.

Change-Id: I6d3d00081a983be0fdf0adbe66b79751439fcce5

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Port load balancing fix

Return the port WWN as opposed to the node WWN
from port information.

Change-Id: I6b3d7c4955639d79d5b5b49dce247bc71e1c44df
(cherry picked from commit 6ddbdc5e88c3422d6a32481c6b44562c53698aef)

subject: PowerMax Driver - Fix for GVG snapshot delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-29 13:58:35.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/provision.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/test_powermax_provision.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/powermax/rest.py'], 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - Fix for GVG snapshot delete

If a Generic Volume Group (PowerMax storage group) has volumes
added or removed from it since a group snapshot was taken, the
deletion of this group snapshot will fail unless a force flag
is supplied.

Change-Id: I97bdc54e41aa51bf44e986cc1779b92acea2b47d
(cherry picked from commit 794e31bba34d849ad99ad938b314f14f840a2f4a)
'}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Fix for GVG snapshot delete

If a Generic Volume Group (PowerMax storage group) has volumes
added or removed from it since a group snapshot was taken, the
deletion of this group snapshot will fail unless a force flag
is supplied.

Change-Id: I97bdc54e41aa51bf44e986cc1779b92acea2b47d
(cherry picked from commit 794e31bba34d849ad99ad938b314f14f840a2f4a)

subject: Enable healthcheck middleware by default
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-08-21 02:04:39.000000000', 'files': ['tools/config/config-generator.sahara.conf', 'releasenotes/notes/healthcheck-02e429a3ffcd9482.yaml', 'etc/sahara/api-paste.ini'], 'message': 'Enable healthcheck middleware by default

Healthcheck middleware provides the /healthcheck endpoint which is
useful for loadbalancer or monitoring tools to check health of api
services. This change enables the middleware by default.

Note that this endpoint has no authentication. The /healthcheck entry
should be removed from api-paste.ini to disable the middleware again.

Change-Id: I1bc61afff2851bb8efac3ec5101a5198f204f41e
'}]
commit_message:
Enable healthcheck middleware by default

Healthcheck middleware provides the /healthcheck endpoint which is
useful for loadbalancer or monitoring tools to check health of api
services. This change enables the middleware by default.

Note that this endpoint has no authentication. The /healthcheck entry
should be removed from api-paste.ini to disable the middleware again.

Change-Id: I1bc61afff2851bb8efac3ec5101a5198f204f41e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-10-26 11:59:24.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Preinstall requirements for docs build and fix lower constraints

Sphinx installs the package with its dependencies, but it does not use
the constraints. This can lead to errors if a dependency introduces any
backward incompatible changes. To avoid this the dependencies needs to
be installed prior to sphinx run by tox with the correct constraints.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

NOTE(elod.illes):
* conflict is due to branch specific upper constraints setting patch.
* sahara-openstack-ansible-functional job is passing in victoria so
  that part is not needed in stable/victoria
* this patch also corrects the contradicting lower constraints to make
  the lower-constraints job pass (with the new pip dependency resolver,
  introduced in pip 20.3, the job started to show the contradictions
  and thus started to fail):
  - oslo.service 1.24.0 version contradicts with eventlet 0.26.0 lower
    constraint
  - alembic 0.9.6 is required for oslo.db 6.0.0
  - cryptography 2.5 is required for paramiko 2.7.1
  - amqp 2.6.0 is required for kombu 5.0.1
  - warlock 1.3.1 is required for jsonschema 3.2.0
  - six 1.11.0 is in requirements.txt, update to same in l-c.txt

Change-Id: I4ba83f1007dd11801b8e32c6d7566769e005480b
(cherry picked from commit e0136189fc147deb7c4b92ed93eabb3cdcb9b7bb)
(cherry picked from commit 0900fc028cd46e368e5fad2cf6f5e73a240b295f)
'}]
commit_message:
Preinstall requirements for docs build and fix lower constraints

Sphinx installs the package with its dependencies, but it does not use
the constraints. This can lead to errors if a dependency introduces any
backward incompatible changes. To avoid this the dependencies needs to
be installed prior to sphinx run by tox with the correct constraints.

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

NOTE(elod.illes):
* conflict is due to branch specific upper constraints setting patch.
* sahara-openstack-ansible-functional job is passing in victoria so
  that part is not needed in stable/victoria
* this patch also corrects the contradicting lower constraints to make
  the lower-constraints job pass (with the new pip dependency resolver,
  introduced in pip 20.3, the job started to show the contradictions
  and thus started to fail):
  - oslo.service 1.24.0 version contradicts with eventlet 0.26.0 lower
    constraint
  - alembic 0.9.6 is required for oslo.db 6.0.0
  - cryptography 2.5 is required for paramiko 2.7.1
  - amqp 2.6.0 is required for kombu 5.0.1
  - warlock 1.3.1 is required for jsonschema 3.2.0
  - six 1.11.0 is in requirements.txt, update to same in l-c.txt

Change-Id: I4ba83f1007dd11801b8e32c6d7566769e005480b
(cherry picked from commit e0136189fc147deb7c4b92ed93eabb3cdcb9b7bb)
(cherry picked from commit 0900fc028cd46e368e5fad2cf6f5e73a240b295f)

subject: Swift backend: the key parameter should be secret
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-25 12:31:30.000000000', 'files': ['spec/defines/glance_backend_multistore_swift_spec.rb', 'manifests/backend/multistore/swift.pp'], 'message': "Swift backend: the key parameter should be secret

The key parameter of swift backend is used to define a credentail to
access Swift so should be hidden in logs.

In Glance the user parameter(swift_store_user) is also defined as
a secret parameter. However it defines user name or id and user name
or id is not currently treated as secret in puppet, so this change
doesn't cover the user parameter.

Change-Id: Iac580df4de14ffdb19436417b2830a834efd087d
(cherry picked from commit 4a481929887d88f019467d11fb7c19d8d9311e3e)
"}]
commit_message:
Swift backend: the key parameter should be secret

The key parameter of swift backend is used to define a credentail to
access Swift so should be hidden in logs.

In Glance the user parameter(swift_store_user) is also defined as
a secret parameter. However it defines user name or id and user name
or id is not currently treated as secret in puppet, so this change
doesn't cover the user parameter.

Change-Id: Iac580df4de14ffdb19436417b2830a834efd087d
(cherry picked from commit 4a481929887d88f019467d11fb7c19d8d9311e3e)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3bf62eed408a55815699e7d64f3802e57b3a9178
